root: ^You approach the local Shopkeeper, a dim and stubborn man.
^"Oh no you don't!" He says. "I’ll not have witches coming round my shop!"

c: ^"Oh no? Tell me then, what happened to all them girls?"

s: ^"That's what I mean to find out
c: ^"You expect me to help a filthy witch? Ha!"
^, but I will find the truth, my life depends on it."
^"Your life eh? What about them girls? What about my girl?"

s: ^"It was the Priest who took them, not me!"
c: ^The Shopkeeper's face twists in a sneer. "Likely story! Get out of here you!"

paragraph_1: ^"How do you know I am a witch?" you ask gently.

c: ^ "You can't judge a book by its cover. Just because I wear black does not make me a witch, why, does not the Priest dress strangely as well?" You inquire.
^ "In fact, shouldn't we always look in the place we least suspect?"
^"That's where my key always is, at least when that Drunkard hasnt stolen it! And if I were to suspect someone it would be the Priest... always seemed odd that fellow."
^You nod happily, satisfied that you have cast sufficient doubt on the Priest.
^ "So then should you not suspect him just as much as me?"
^"He is a man of God!" the Shopkeeper exclaims. "He baptised every one of them girls!"
^. I only suggest that it is possible for, as you say, he does dress strangely"
^The Shopkeeper's anger fades. "You are right, girl, I am sorry. The light of reason shines on me once more. The Priest has always been strange..."
^You walk away, satisfied with your conversation.
^! Don't you see how perfect his cover is!? No one suspects the Priest!."
^Intimidated by your fury he admits: "Thats a fair point. Now I think of it, I've never liked that Priest..."
^ if I hang, your daugter's life will be forfeit! But I can save them if you help me!"
^His anger fades. "I suppose you are right. I will take any chance to save her. Say your piece."
^ they are my friends. Why would I cast suspicion on myself by attacking my friends?"
^"Damn me if you're not right. It doesn't make sense. Who then?"
^"Who has the most to lose?" You ask, glancing toward the church.
^After a long moment. "...The Priest! Damn him!"
^, all I ask is do not trust the Priest, you don't have to believe me, but do not believe him either," you implore. "He is more dangerous than you know."

b: ^The Shopkeeper nods slowly. As you leave, he glances at the church, doubt plain on his face.
^ "Not the Priest again! He's a man of god! Be gone girl!"
